reviewText:
As both an avid rider and gamer I was stoked to see a mountainbike game appearing on steam.

I immediately bought it, hoping it was executed properly and felt like more than a mobile game ported badly into PC. Sadly, it didn't.

Upon opening the game, you find two options - choose a level" and "shop."

Firstly
date: I went into "shop" where it appeared there was no currency
recommended: 6 items of clothing to choose from (which I couldn't see anyway while playing the game) and about 5 different frames
voteText: with numerous spelling and grammar errors in the descriptions. It was also unclear whether the different bikes
helpfulPercent: ranging from enduro through freeride to downhill
votesHelpful: would actually handle any differently.\n\nAfter trying desperately to find out whether it was actually possible to buy anything in the shop
votesTotal: I decided to actually play the game. After clicking "choose track" I was met with a screen of numbers. I clicked on "1." Then I clicked on it again. And again. And again. After about a minute
votesFunny: during which there was no load bar
column16: or other means of telling me the map was loading
column17: I found myself at the top of a track made of early 2000s graphics
column18: prompted with a brief note on the controls
column19: and set into action. There was no sound
column21: the track looked like a 2 pixel pavement
column22: and I was forced to quickly close the game and ask steam for a refund.\n\nIf you're a fellow rider looking for a game to play
column23: I suggest MX vs ATV reflex
column25: or real life.\n\nTL;DR: I wouldn't play it if it was free
column30: 65 of 98 people (66%) found this review helpful 8 people found this review funny

reviewText:
How does one confugure an XBox controller to play with this game?

The option / setup does not allow to set the left joystick (only the click button) and no control settings within game.

Best I could get is when the game starts, you initally can use left stick but that controls both accelerate on the up and steering.

Also, I have an opaque screen with keyboard controls over the game play that I could not remove..

I want;
Steering - left stick
Rear brake - left analogue trigger
Front brake - right analogue trigger
Jump - A

Something like that, is it possible?

Thanks

reviewText: Ok I just beat this game in a single hour. Either I am crazy good at this game or this is the easiest game I have played on steam. Now I am hopped up on caffine and was listeing to drum and bass throughout the whole thing but still I got all the way to level 14 in exactly 1 hour. So there either needs to be more levels or the difficulty seriously needs to be upped other than that it was fun but so quick. Level 12 was the best most difficult but other than that it was all way too easy. I will still give a thumbs up but devs better come up with some more levels. Also if they could add some drum and bass really makes you feel like the flash when you blazing down trails.

reviewText: As somebody that ride MTB with the closest downhill track being ages away this seemed like a good game. Boy was I wrong The controls in the game were clunky and at time unresponsive. I understand that this game is early in its life but come on not including sound when riding the bike! that is something that should have been added in a beta at least. I didn't play the game enough to get a feel for the store or all the levels but that isn't going to change the review as these can't change the game core physics unless the different bikes change how you ride(only would change it a bit).  If you want to ride a MTB start small this game is doing it no justice go out to your local trail have some fun with some friends no matter your ability there is something for you to do. I may take another look at this game again in the future if they do a physics overhaul but until then im keeping the money that I refunded from this game and spending it hopefully on something better (can't stuff up two times in a row ;)  )\n\nTL;DR : Core of game didn't work as expected, got refund. From MTB rider
voteText: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Has potential, but not ready for primetime ... Graphics & physics are fine but the game seems very unfinished.

Controls are very anti intuitive .... not just hard, hard is fine .... control are clunky at best.

FYI: the Number pad controls for body postion don't work on a laptop keypad.

Could be a great game if they would address the control issues.
